intro: Borckhausenia ochroleuca, commonly known as the white-leaved borckhausenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense clusters, often surrounded by pale green or white bracts. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving them a soft, fuzzy appearance. Borckhausenia ochroleuca is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
